io.github.pr0methean.betterrandom.util

Class LooperThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • io.github.pr0methean.betterrandom.util.LooperThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RandomSeederThread

    public class LooperThread
extends Thread
implements Serializable, Cloneable

    EXPERIMENTAL. Thread that loops a given task until interrupted (or until JVM shutdown, if it Thread.isDaemon()), with the iterations being transactional. Because of these constraints, it can be serialized and cloned. Subclasses must override iterate() if instantiated without a target Runnable; the only reason this class is concrete is that temporary instances are needed during deserialization.

    Subclasses should override the readResolveConstructorWrapper() method to ensure they are deserialized as a subclass instance.

    iterate()'s body should be reasonably short, since it will block serialization and cloning that would otherwise catch it in mid-iteration.

    Thread state that WILL be restored includes:

    • Thread.getName()
    • Thread.getPriority()
    • getState() == State#NEW
    • getState() == State#TERMINATED
    • Thread.isInterrupted()
    • Thread.isDaemon()

    Thread state that will be restored ONLY if its values are Serializable includes:

    • Thread.getThreadGroup()
    • getUncaughtExceptionHandler()
    • Thread.getContextClassLoader()

    Thread state that will NEVER be restored includes:

    • Program counter, call stack, and local variables. The seederThread will restart.
    • Suspended status (see Thread.suspend()
    • getState() == State#TIMED_WAITING
    • getState() == State#WAITING
    • getState() == State#BLOCKED
    • Thread.getId()
    • Thread.holdsLock(Object)
    Author:
    Chris Hennick
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • readResolve

        protected Object readResolve()
                      throws InvalidObjectException
        Use readResolve rather than readObject, because stack size and thread group can only be restored in Thread constructors.
        Returns:
        A LooperThread that will replace this one during deserialization.
        Throws:
        InvalidObjectException - if this LooperThread's serial form is invalid.

      • readResolveConstructorWrapper

        @RequiresNonNull(value={"group","target","name"})
protected LooperThread readResolveConstructorWrapper()
                                                                                                throws InvalidObjectException
        Returns:
        A new LooperThread whose group is group, whose target is target, whose name is name, whose stack size is stackSize and that either has its subclass fields copied from this one or overrides readResolve() to populate them.
        Throws:
        InvalidObjectException - if this LooperThread's serial form is invalid.

      • iterate

        protected boolean iterate()
                   throws InterruptedException
        The task that will be iterated until it returns false. Cannot be abstract for serialization reasons, but must be overridden in subclasses if they are instantiated without a target Runnable.
        Returns:
        true if this thread should continue to iterate.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if any.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this method has not been overridden.
